title: Grade 1
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

4FC78B36C0F048D8919DC1E9E01609B7.description:
Identify information related to personal experiences and answer simple
questions about those experiences (EE.W.1.8).

81B19DDE49FF4CDE8EB0BE0E8579D0E7.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (EE.W.1.7).

F9E697CF4F564C01B45263BD403DBD7E.description: Locate text features (e.g., title, author, illustrator, cover).

B38BE882A0BD4334B3F859DC54A91BD2.description:
Use a variety of provided resources to answer questions of interest
throughout guided inquiry with peers.

1FF519DDD7834ACEB0141C22F74EAFA5.description: Creates questions about a topic that was discussed in class.

21451CF40E14472391A24D787178F5C3.description: During shared writing, actively participates in group writing projects.

0C81773D982F4DA39409A27679321344.description: With guidance and support students can:

589B703EEF4344BFA1B928B7CECC68B4.description: Participate in shared research and inquiry projects, writing, recalling, or gathering information to answer questions.

948ABD2A5DB4464EAED3150303BBF7AD.description:
During shared writing, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish
writing, including guided collaboration with peers.

F7AAD0B811FF4EF58E1952341875A51E.description:
During shared writing, adds a detail, to strengthen writing based on guided
peer feedback.

BD069E2DF4F44FD9AC5ED60F0EF2557E.description:
During shared writing, identify the letters that represent sounds needed
to spell words (EE.L.1.2e).

3E80CCC4A86545A3906A0102AA225B2E.description: During shared writing, put a period at the end of a sentence (EE.L.1.2b).

BF5FDA279147441F88ED3FB9049840C7.description: Use simple question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what) (EE.L1.1j).

5B85924AD532449EBFB371F64138BC9B.description: Use common prepositions (e.g., on, off, in, out) (EE.L.1.1i).

ADA2311BE5074E4580E927C0DDC5D2AA.description: Use familiar frequently occurring adjectives (e.g., big, hot) (EE.L.1.1f).

3A27513C45A84738A35DB1E15093AD36.description: Use familiar personal pronouns (e.g., I, me, and you) (EE.L.1.1d).

03A7A5B1232C45F1B763999AA1E2E50E.description: Use frequently occurring nouns in communication (EE.L.1.1b).

09E90BB4BDDE452799F67AE1DD9B5EC2.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of letter and word use (EE.L.1.1).

718AC77C551A43909687943D6F61E89C.description: With guidance and support students can:

9765DC87C7D24992B23FA4C3600374E3.description: Use appropriate grammar, spelling, capitalization, and punctuation.

AB169256E4364E7497BC3E11D68E817D.description: Select a closure statement about an event.

E0E9DF1CAA6C42A8B64B858A085123D0.description: Select at least two details about an event.

62D4FCC6880F4C6B86451F1767B62977.description:
Select an event and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share information
about it (EE.W.1.3).

44A8F3D7F2B940FA92B84B3F9E16885B.description: With guidance and support students can:

4A541D681AFF42B8A22368DE22FBAA08.description: Recount real or imagined, sequenced events that include details and a sense of closure.

9D21B0C76DF8469B9C19ADAC080E5A99.description: Select a closure statement from a list.

5B9633A0B9BE40F7B4841C92CF8DA967.description:
Select a familiar topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share
information about it (EE.W.1.2).

7B36C02D9CED4FA49D71C95D41133934.description: Select a topic when given choices.

D8D446777D964D35B94E9E6F3B13643F.description: With guidance and support students can:

A02AF6512F2E452584C8CA96B503E2FE.description: Write informative/explanatory texts by naming a topic, providing related details, and giving the audience a sense of closure.

15AF90DB6E5B4F08821E6D87E93F6D1B.description: Identify a reason for an opinion about a book or topic.

D8123CEBD4C1493681AA8275690C476C.description:
Select a familiar book and use drawing, dictating, or writing to state an
opinion about it (EE.W.1.1).

BB9FC9D74E814C678BA381D447599854.description: When writing about a topic or book, identify the topic or name of the book.

99D818ED5434474EA04CB4B59B468FE9.description: With guidance and support students can:

452A518B3C3345A8BCAB898999293191.description: Write an opinion supported by reasons.

1B276E691E3E490181EED5C3D540A6FB.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities (EE.L.1.6).

548604D7FAE3483EA176391BD5AD0083.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words by identifying real-life
connections between words and their use (EE.L.1.5c).

D9C5E9D9F7CF46EA8F078676E122C194.description: Sort common objects into familiar categories (EE.L.1.5a).

D5C8B50201774946831E64D09F55FE8B.description: Demonstrate understanding of words used in every day routines (EE.L.1.5).

F303FB56E45D441EA244D25E8E6034FC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words used in every day routines
(EE.L.1.4a).

B8D9E780C87A4BFFABE76986C1D0820F.description: Demonstrate of emerging knowledge of word meanings (EE.L.1.4).

759BA69B09034F60B7689A546BF1FC74.description:
Participate in shared reading of a variety of reading materials reflecting
a variety of text genre (EE.RF.1.4b).

6E8936E0DABD487FB24E3CF67D7F3069.description: Engage in sustained, independent study of books (EE.RF.1.4a).

06EE8D137D644000A66F753BE1B53A02.description: Begin to attend to words in print (EE.RF.1.4).

412B79C1787747DB8D7991C401DF939F.description:
Recognize familiar words that are used in everyday routines
(EE.RF.1.3b).

A2047FD05591419485D5AA309810D679.description: Identify upper case letters of the alphabet (EE.RF.1.3a).

9989D9C2AD334D0CAC5D5F46C8C2709B.description: Demonstrate emerging letter and word identification skills (EE.RF.1.3).

C318035E970F4CC698F4328A006A25C2.description:
Substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words
to make new words (EE.RF.1.2d).

E7EC09E35DC14A85B0751F4AD5943665.description:
Identify a single syllable spoken word with the same onset (beginning
sound) as a familiar word (EE.RF.1.2c).

19EA79EC84374266B82F19C196B9C326.description:
Match orally presented segmented phonemes (e.g., C-A-T) to pictures or
words illustrating the corresponding word (EE.RF.1.2b).

87963D1701EC4B38B49A5D4FBD5321C3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes) (EE.RF.1.2).

AA07ACE0059545CCB4EA39428A980359.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of
print (e.g., left-to-right, one-to-one correspondence between written
and spoken word) (EE.RF.1.1a).

5B343F5B1EC847009DEE4E9A8F22FE63.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of the organization of print
(EE.RF.1.1).

942E75CC46DA4824A290CAF7E3129EC6.description: With guidance and support students can:

7551FC6FAACA4DFCAE0C937FFC4F12D9.description: Refine foundational reading skills through understanding word structure, word relationships, and word families.

F1EE1120F38B4681A152E73AE0225822.description: Actively engage in shared reading of informational text (EE.RI.1.10).

4B3ED270ADE6481D8C80D40CDC33B903.description: Match similar parts of two texts on the same topic (EE.RI.1.9).

E1CB0E1057FB484191F99FC69FB76944.description:
Identify points the author makes in a familiar informational text
(EE.RI.1.8).

8C0A175D3EB748DF828388EB30EE94BC.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar
text (EE.RI.1.7).

9E23A1DDC87C4148A20D2EAF94036C99.description: Distinguish between words and illustrations in a text (EE.RI.1.6).

A5A48A6B201341BA85E8C51BC4B14A19.description: Locate the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book (EE.RI.1.5).

C58ADC05BA8F4B2C834A29582579F249.description: Ask a reader to clarify the meaning of a word in a text (EE.RI.1.4).

BC9DF0C22D6349F0A32B3F9BF78E3B9A.description:
Identify individuals, events, or details in a familiar informational text
(EE.RI.1.3).

48479BC6F6CA457B80D1610FC480AB90.description: Identify details related to the topic of a text (EE.RI.1.2)

31AD50F56A2945B7B61F3BBAC125EC7A.description: With guidance and support students can:

DD87D3967A5F456FB8F8D673FFFB152B.description: Apply foundational reading strategies to fluently read and comprehend informational texts.

612D2E62B5F04DDC9405857AD9CFEFD7.description: Actively engage in shared reading for a clearly stated purpose (EE.RL.1.10).

7C0F34093FFF4C16AF3681AF25867CBA.description:
Identify adventures or experiences of characters in a story as same or
different (EE.RL.1.9)

DCA3625104BD4A3196D5F3B2181C5B74.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar
story (EE.RL.1.7).

63725CCAB8774D3D8A7428F3CD43C210.description: Identify a speaker within a familiar story (EE.RL.1.6).

C6E879D7A98543498CBB5F84D2B1930F.description: Identify a text as telling a story (EE.RL.1.5).

0A2D98F242C8410282875FE43C6D5448.description: Match a picture to an activity (EE.RL.1.4).

6A8668F4262D4776BFA57E6A0AA7C1B3.description: Make predictions about what will happen in a text.

90FCFCFBFAF047A68610F697E37BF793.description: Identify characters and settings in a familiar story (EE.Rl.1.3).

DDB2161A75264DB7B3CFAB36E42CAF33.description: Recount major events in familiar stories (EE.RL.1.2).

8E001C10C76F48B4898C24C08979BF1A.description: With guidance and support students can:

FB77D929ADA34CEFBE888A4E0B7B5F96.description: Apply foundational reading strategies to fluently read and comprehend literary texts.

2D7028BBCFA34C50919C2C8B1B534A0D.description: Produce a sentence when appropriate to a task or situation.

3816F6EA13714D17B066C6CC90D40C74.description:
Add drawing, visual display, or other media to clarify writing products or
oral discussions.

58CE248B421449B49C3746F8B0105470.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and feelings with at least one
detail.

0FFE046D2255455081DF42C56C825342.description: With guidance and support students can:

5B97894003F84A2AA271D192E5749B4D.description: Use multiple strategies to develop and expand oral communication.

4AE86A0B15BE415383A11E38321DA9E8.description:
Communicate confusion or lack of understanding (e.g., “I don’t know.”)
(EE.SL.1.3).

8652B7C992CC4A37BF937B9016562E5C.description:
During shared reading activities, answer questions about details presented
orally or through other media (EE.SL.1.2).

37A2EABA132A4830AC8DBB52303115D0.description:
Uses one or two words to ask questions related to personally relevant
topics (EE.SL.1.1c).

4AFE5F9E676A40B3912D4CDB7B64FB0F.description: Build on comments or topics initiated by an adult (EE.SL.1.1b).

6C83101869C94C0084FE39B92114E74C.description: Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with supportive adults (EE.SL.1.1a).

53E6685F13DE4D8FA2C52E00F1AD4210.description: With guidance and support students can:

5D8D7370A8C54F4E8B8325B60E7B1302.description: Communicate using verbal and nonverbal language to express and receive information.
